Job Title: Energy Markets Analyst - BESS & Solar Operations
Ad Text:
ABOUT THE COMPANY




FRV (Fotowatio Renewable Ventures) was one of the first international solar developers to enter the Australian market and developed its first Australian solar PV project pipeline in 2011, opening the local solar market. FRV was also the first company to deliver a project-financed large-scale solar farm in Australia with the Royalla Solar Farm near Canberra operating since August 2014.




To date, FRV Australia has developed approximately 970 MWdc of PV capacity built and in operation across seven projects, representing a total project investment value of over one billion dollars. In addition FRV Australia has 350MW of BESS capacity under construction across two projects, and a strong pipeline of projects composed of standalone BESS and solar-BESS hybrid projects. The Sydney-based multidisciplinary team continues to grow across the energy, finance, and digital analytics domains.




In 2021, FRV partnered with OMERS Infrastructure through the sale of 49% of FRV Australia ‚Äî a partnership that reinforces confidence in FRV‚Äôs portfolio and accelerates its operational growth and data-driven optimisation objectives.







THE ROLE




Purpose of the Role: To support the operational and market optimisation of FRV‚Äôs growing portfolio of grid-connected battery and solar assets across the National Electricity Market (NEM). The role focuses on BESS onboarding, operational readiness, market performance tracking, and dispatch analysis, ensuring FRV‚Äôs assets achieve optimal performance in real-time and over the asset life cycle.




About the Role: The Energy Markets Analyst ‚Äì BESS, Solar and Hybrid Market Operations role will provide hands-on analytical and operational support for FRV‚Äôs entry into battery energy storage operations within the NEM. Initially focused on BESS & Hybrid projects, the position will manage data analysis, market monitoring, and performance tracking to ensure optimal dispatch and value capture.




Reporting to the Head of Energy Markets and working closely with O&M, Asset Management, and Business Intelligence teams, this role will help integrate operational insights with market analytics to support the real-time management of FRV‚Äôs BESS, Solar and hybrid assets.







MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES




Support the onboarding and operational readiness of new BESS projects entering the NEM.

Monitor real-time market conditions, dispatch behaviour, and asset bidding performance using internal and third party tools and internal BI dashboards.

Track and analyse BESS performance metrics, including cycling, co-optimisation (Wholesale + FCAS), and curtailment impacts.

Conduct deep-dive revenue and performance analyses to identify optimisation opportunities.

Coordinate with O&M, Asset Management, and Trading teams to ensure responsiveness and market compliance.

Manage BESS performance modelling, forecasting, and risk analysis, including percentage of perfect foresight metrics.

Track and interpret market and regulatory changes relevant to battery and hybrid asset operations.

Support reporting and data integration across technical and commercial systems.

Collaborate across FRV teams to enhance internal understanding of BESS operations and market behaviour.







SKILLS & EXPERTISE




Passionate about the energy transition and the future of renewable generation and storage.

Strong understanding of the National Electricity Market (NEM), market rules, regulations and operations (wholesale, FCAS), and energy policy environment.

Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex analysis into clear commercial insights.

Flexible and adaptable ‚Äî comfortable working in a dynamic organisation with changing priorities.

Strong analytical and data skills: SQL, Azure, Python, Power BI, and Excel.

Experienced in market or commercial analysis, preferably within an energy, utilities, or infrastructure environment.

Strong stakeholder management and collaboration skills across commercial, technical, and operational teams.

Detail-oriented, intellectually curious, and comfortable operating at strategic, tactical and operational levels.

Open to innovative thinking and willing to challenge the status quo







OUR BENEFITS




Competitive salary.

22 days annual leave.

Employee Assistance Program (EAP).

Corporate membership and discount to ClassPass.

Birthday Leave.

Paid parental leave.

Training and development opportunities to enhance your career growth.

Spanish Lessons.

Collaborative and innovative culture.

Corporate events and more!

All tools and PPE provided.




If you are interested in this position, please apply now. We look forward to discussing this exciting opportunity with you soon. *Please be advised that due to large number of applications, only shortlisted applicants will be contacted .




At FRV Australia we are committed to providing our employees with a supportive and rewarding work environment. We offer a friendly work environment, collaborative and inclusive team culture and stable ongoing work.

Location: Melbourne CBD
Length: 4 Months Day Rate Contract
Hybrid: Flexible (Not Remote)¬†

About the Company:
¬†¬†
Our client is a leading organisation at the forefront of there field. With a strong commitment to innovation and operational excellence, they offer a collaborative environment where professionals are empowered to drive meaningful change. The team is embracing new technologies (including AI) to transform business processes and deliver lasting impact for their stakeholders and the wider community.
¬†¬†
As a Process Analyst, you will play a vital role in reviewing, mapping, and enhancing business processes to improve operational efficiency and support our strategic objectives. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders across the organisation to identify areas for improvement, drive change initiatives, and ensure processes are well documented and aligned with company goals.

Key Responsibilities:

Analysing current business processes to identify inefficiencies, bottlenecks, and opportunities for improvement.
Designing and documenting future-state processes using industry best practices such as Lean Six Sigma and BPMN 2.0.
Leading workshops and working with senior stakeholders to gather requirements, validate solutions, and secure buy in.
Preparing and maintaining clear process documentation, including SOPs, journey maps, data flows, and training materials.
Conducting gap analyses and change impact assessments to support the successful implementation of new processes or systems.
Developing and monitoring KPIs and metrics to track process performance and encourage continuous improvement.
Ensuring process changes comply with regulatory standards and internal governance policies.
Providing reports, insights, and recommendations to leadership and other stakeholders.
Proactively identifying risks and contributing to the development of mitigation strategies.
Key Competencies:

Comfortable working in a dynamic environment with evolving priorities.
Strong relationship-building and stakeholder management skills, particularly with senior leaders.
High attention to detail and accuracy.
Proactive, collaborative, and solutions-focused mindset.
Professional approach with a commitment to continuous improvement.
Ability to think creatively and take initiative.
Experience in the health, education, or science sectors is desirable.
Familiarity with Artificial Intelligence and its upstream requirements is advantageous.

How to Apply
To apply, please click ‚ÄòApply‚Äô to submit your CV online. For any questions or to discuss the role confidentially, please email jtinton@quinnallan.com.au or call 0412 270 164.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping business strategies and delivering enterprise-aligned solutions within our GBIS PMO team. This full-time, permanent, hybrid position (3 days in-office) is ideal for experienced professionals who thrive on solving complex business challenges, influencing senior stakeholders, and driving transformational change.¬†

You‚Äôll be part of a collaborative team based in Collins Street, contributing to strategic programs and mentoring other analysts to build organisational capability.¬†

Please note that this role is only open to Australian Citizens.¬†

¬†

About the role¬†

Lead requirements gathering for large, complex, multi-stakeholder programs across business and technology domains.¬†

Develop business cases and define enterprise-level requirements, ensuring full traceability through design, build, testing, and deployment.¬†

Conduct AS IS and TO BE process analysis across multiple business units using BPMN 2.0 standards.¬†

Collaborate with architects, solution designers, finance, and operational leaders to shape strategic solutions aligned with organisational and client outcomes.¬†

Work closely with finance teams to ensure clear understanding of end-to-end finance and commercial processes including procurement, client billing, contract variations, and cost management.¬†

Act as a trusted advisor to executives, influencing priorities and scope.¬†

Mentor junior and mid-level analysts, promoting consistency in methods and tools.¬†

Contribute to governance forums and track benefits realisation linked to BA deliverables.¬†

Drive alignment of business requirements with enterprise architecture and future-state capabilities.¬†

¬†

Skills and experience¬†

Strategic thinker with strong analytical and problem-solving skills.¬†

Must have Australian Citizenship.¬†

Deep experience in utilities, transport, telecommunications, or other asset-intensive and field-operations industries.¬†

Must have experience with implementation or optimisation of Field Service Management systems.¬†

Strong understanding of finance and commercial processes, including procurement, work order management, billing cycles, invoicing, and revenue recognition.¬†

Advanced facilitation, negotiation, and conflict management abilities.¬†

Excellent communication and stakeholder engagement skills, including executive-level relationships.¬†

Ability to work autonomously while thriving in fast-paced and collaborative environments.¬†

Leadership and mentoring capability with a focus on building BA practice maturity and consistent analysis standards.¬†

¬†¬†

Experience:¬†

7+ years in business analysis with proven success in IT environments.¬†

Extensive experience in business process modelling (BPMN 2.0) and enterprise-level analysis.¬†

Strong background in ERP or finance-related programs and large-scale implementations.¬†

Proficiency in tools such as Visio, JIRA, Confluence, and advanced data analysis methods.¬†

Exposure to Agile frameworks and ability to guide teams in Agile practices.¬†

¬†

About Us¬†

Service Stream is an equal opportunity ASX-listed business that develops and operates Australia's essential services networks across telecommunications, utilities, transport, defence, and social infrastructure industries. We keep communities connected.¬†




Benefits of working with us include:¬†

A safe and supportive culture that values diversity and inclusion.¬†

Flexible hybrid working arrangements.¬†

Genuine career development and advancement opportunities.¬†

Access to special employee benefits and discounts.¬†

Various paid leave options ‚Äì parental, cultural, community service, study, corporate volunteering, and purchased leave.¬†




How to apply¬†

Please submit your interest with the Apply button where you will be directed to create a profile on our system. We celebrate diversity at Service Stream and welcome applications from Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with a disability or neurodivergence, and those from LGBTIQA+, Veteran or other diverse groups.¬†
Applications will not be accepted via email. If you require any reasonable adjustments to the recruitment process, please email talent.corporate@servicestream.com.au.

Job Title: Business and Finance Analyst - Facilities Management
Ad Text:
THE FUTURE IS WHAT WE MAKE IT.

Abbotsford, VIC

From sustainable aviation fuel and life-saving healthcare sensors to collaborating on every NASA space mission since the 1950‚Äôs, over 100 years of innovation has always been driven by an investment in our people. Take hold of a monster opportunity and join our Security Operations - Technology team as a Data Protection Lead.‚ÄØ If you‚Äôre a good fit for this role and live in Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne, we‚Äôd love you to apply.¬†

Why join us?

You'll get 14% super as standard, to help your future come alive.
Unleash your potential and build a career to be proud of through excellent training and development opportunities.
Balance your work between in-person days at our purpose-built hubs and working from home.
In the office, enjoy end of trip facilities, a yoga and multi-faith room, parent and carer rooms, quiet rooms, BrewHub coffee facilities, and collaborative team spaces.

About the role

We‚Äôre all about helping our members make the most of their money. And while they go after their goals, you can too. We‚Äôre looking for an experienced and passionate Lead who will take their knowledge in security and data to protect our members personal information. As Data Protection Lead, you‚Äôll:¬†

Lead tactical and strategic uplift for data protection and security processes, including supporting responsible adoption of AI technologies.
Act as the technical owner for Varonis and Microsoft Purview, designing, building, and maintaining policies for discovery scanning, classification, labelling, DLP detection, monitoring, reporting, and alerting.
Oversee the response to discovery, analysis, and exporting of digital evidence for cyber incidents, HR investigations, financial crime reviews, and legal proceedings, ensuring compliance with internal policies and regulatory obligations.
Central ownership of DLP controls and solutions across endpoint, storage, cloud services, and email platforms.
Consulting on data security requirements across ART‚Äôs data governance strategy and programs, integrating data protection controls and recommending technologies.
Leading investigations into data access anomalies, insider threats, and policy violations, enforcing controls and supporting breach detection.
Contributing to strategic planning and governance initiatives within Information Security and broader enterprise programs.
Playing a key role in training and awareness programs to promote a culture of data protection across ART, and staying current with emerging threats, technologies, and regulatory changes.

This role is a permanent opportunity.¬†

üìç¬†Location: Brisbane, Sydney or Melbourne.¬†

About you

It goes without saying you'll be a great communicator with top notch interpersonal skills. We'll also expect you to pick up problems and come up with quick, creative ways to solve them. It's quite likely you tick some of the following boxes too:¬†¬†

Proven hands-on experience leading and managing data protection platforms such as Microsoft Purview and Varonis, including policy design and configuration.
Tactical and strategic understanding of data discovery, classification, labelling, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP) controls across endpoints, cloud, storage, and email.
Hands-on experience with eDiscovery tools, especially Microsoft eDiscovery, and managing digital evidence handling processes.
Demonstrated ability to monitor and investigate data access anomalies, insider threats, and policy violations.
Experience supporting or leading evidence gathering for HR investigations and legal proceedings involving digital evidence.
Experience aligning technical controls with enterprise data governance strategies.
Strong stakeholder engagement skills across security, data, AI, and technical teams.
Ability to contribute to training and awareness programs that promote a culture of data protection.
Solid understanding of data governance frameworks, privacy legislation, and regulatory obligations (e.g., Australian Privacy Act, APRA CPS 234).
Experience contributing to enterprise-wide data governance or risk management strategy.
Experience supporting or leading cybersecurity or IT incident response.
Experience leading or mentoring technical staff.
Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology, Information Security, Data Science, or equivalent experience.
Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, or Microsoft Certified: Information Protection Administrator.

About us

Our 2.4 million members trust us to take care of over $330 billion in retirement savings. And we help them take charge of their finances and face the future with confidence. Our inclusive culture means you‚Äôll be valued and heard in a respectful workplace. We've created an environment where you can be yourself and do amazing work. It's that simple.

Apply online now

Everyone is welcome to apply. We value diverse thinking, cultures, perspectives, backgrounds, and abilities. Awaken your career at Australian Retirement Trust and apply now. Applications close 11:30pm 12 December 2025.¬†

We don‚Äôt want to leave you with a monstrous wait. So, you‚Äôll hear from us after the closing date to find out whether you‚Äôve made it through to the next round or not. Being fair and up-front is important to us ‚Äì and recruitment is no different.

About the Role:

Why Join:
Be part of a dynamic environment, contributing to SAP excellence, continuous improvement, and S/4HANA transformation while working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive business impact.

Company overview:
One of Australia‚Äôs leading financial institutions, offering a full range of banking, wealth, and investment services across retail, commercial, and institutional sectors. Known for its strong presence in the Asia-Pacific region and commitment to innovation and customer service.

Responsibilities:

Supporting the creation of the annual Audit Plan and allocating resources according to the risk profile of different business areas.
Planning, leading, and conducting audit engagements in line with the annual plan and established audit methodology.
Reviewing business areas with an emphasis on technology, data, and process automation.
Evaluating the effectiveness and adequacy of controls to manage and mitigate risks.

What you'll need to succeed:¬†

Proven experience leading multiple technology audit engagements or risk teams, handling medium to high complexity and high-profile reviews from the financial services or professional services industries.
Extensive experience auditing technology within markets operations, with strong knowledge of market products/platforms and processes.
Substantial experience conducting audits across complex technology environments.
Expertise in technology risk management combined with solid banking and financial markets knowledge.
Skilled in risk and control analysis of complex business areas, using insights and data to design and deliver effective assurance.
Strong negotiation, influencing, and conflict resolution capabilities, particularly in a market-focused audit context.
Open to candidates from Sydney or Melbourne

With over 90 years' combined experience, NES Fircroft (NES) is proud to be the world's leading engineering staffing provider spanning the Oil & Gas, Power & Renewables, Chemicals, Construction & Infrastructure, Life Sciences, Mining and¬†Manufacturing¬†sectors worldwide. With more than 80 offices in 45 countries, we are able to provide our clients with the engineering and technical expertise they need, wherever and whenever it is needed. At Wesfarmers Health we strive to make health, beauty and wellness experiences simpler, more affordable and easier to access for all Australians.

Our portfolio includes well-known names like Priceline, as well as our MediAesthetics brands - Clear Skincare Clinics and SILK Laser Clinics. In the digital space, we're proud to have SISU Health and InstantScripts‚Äîand most recently, we've launched our newest retail beauty stores, atomica.





About us:

What began in 1910 as a small co-operative of just three pharmacies has grown into Wesfarmers Health‚Äîa leading Australian organisation in health, beauty, and wellness.

Today, Wesfarmers Health proudly employs over 3,600 team members, all committed to delivering accessible, innovative, and trusted health and beauty services to Australians nationwide, across retail, medi-aesthetics, digital health, and wholesale and supply chain operations.

What you'll do:

We're looking for a Strategy Analyst - Merchandise to join our Commercial Excellence team in the Pharmacy & Retail business unit. In this role, you'll work closely with the Senior Strategy Manager - Merchandise to shape data-driven strategies that improve profit, drive efficiency, and unlock growth across our merchandise categories.

You'll analyse market trends, competitor activities, and merchandise performance to generate insights that help guide decision-making. Your work will support category strategy development, create strong business cases, and contribute to initiatives that enhance the value we deliver to customers and franchise partners.

Key responsibilities include:

Contributing to category strategy development using strategic frameworks and data-driven approaches.
Conducting market research, competitor analysis, and identifying consumer trends.
Analysing merchandise performance and market data to generate actionable insights.
Building financial models to assess opportunities and execution strategies.
Creating guidelines and playbooks to support category teams in implementing strategies.
Tracking and evaluating the performance of merchandising initiatives and recommending improvements.

What you'll bring:

Demonstrated experience in strategy consulting, merchandising, data and analytics, customer insights, or a related field.
Proven track record of working on complex and strategic projects.
Thought leader and critical thinker with strong analytical skills and a customer-focused approach.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with strong influencing abilities.
Exceptional organisational skills and the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team and effectively engage with individuals at all levels within an organisation.
Bachelor's degree with a consistently outstanding academic record.

Why us?

Access to employee benefits across Wesfarmers including team member discounts at Bunnings, Kmart, Target, Officeworks, OnePass, Priceline and Clear Skincare Clinics.
Ongoing professional development and career opportunities across the Wesfarmers Health Division and the broader Wesfarmers Group.
Novated leasing options
Access to our Employee Assistance Program (EAP) - available to all team members and their immediate family members, 24/7, 365 days a year
Beautiful outdoor terrace for work and recreation.
Food, coffee and health & wellbeing facilities onsite including a landlord operated gym
Dedicated end of trip facilities (cycle racks, showers, lockers).

Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants

Wesfarmers Health aims to become an employer of choice for First Nations Australians, through investments that attract, empower and retain First Nations team members within our stores, distribution centres, clinics and corporate offices.

As part of the Wesfarmers group, we provide authentic support through a diverse range of programs and initiatives, designed to empower you on your journey towards personal achievement and professional advancement.

At Tyremax, we are driven by a powerful purpose ‚Äì ‚ÄúConnecting Our Partners with Solutions for Mutual Success.‚Äù We bring this to life by forging trusted, enduring partnerships with our suppliers and delivering compelling, customer-focused solutions that help our partners grow and succeed.
¬†¬†
Proudly independently owned and operated since 1972, Tyremax is the leading tyre wholesaler across Australia and New Zealand (ANZ). With a diverse portfolio of globally recognised brands.
¬†¬†
At Tyremax, our people are united by shared values of Care, Trust, Teamwork, Drive and Humility. We don‚Äôt just distribute tyres ‚Äì we help power the journeys that keep industries moving, communities connected and businesses thriving. Join us as we continue to shape the future of tyre distribution with purpose, performance and partnership at the heart of everything we do.
¬†¬†
As Tyremax accelerates its enterprise transformation and evolves its commercial operating model, we are searching for an exceptional commercial strategist for our Pricing and Data Leader role across ANZ. This pivotal role will be a member of the senior leadership team, driving enterprise-wide impact with elevated visibility and opportunities for personal growth.

The role is based in Thomastown, Victoria reporting to the Chief Merchandising Officer. The opportunity is to architect, deploy and scale a data-led pricing framework that helps fuel the next horizon of sustainable growth, driving customer value within a market leading organisation.
¬†¬†
Responsibilities:

Lead the enterprise-wide pricing strategy and operating model (processes, guardrails, governances) aligned to brand, channel and growth ambitions across Australia and New Zealand
Act as trusted pricing advisor to the Executive Leadership Team, providing evidence-based recommendations for planning, negotiations, and investment decisions
Drive automation, digitisation and AI-assisted pricing
Build commercial governance that strengthens discipline, reduces leakage, and aligns Sales, Category, and Finance
Champion value-based pricing, competitive benchmarking, elasticity modelling and customer deal economics
Drive strategic pricing initiatives that unlock new value pools and uplift profitability
Deploy, embed and scale new ways of working
Develop dashboards, forecasting tools and BI reporting that enhances visibility and accountability
Track price realisation, gross profit, promotional ROI and highlight improvement actions
Influence strategy, commercial outcomes and digital transformation including the ERP rollout across ANZ
Implement testing frameworks, change management and training programs to drive system adoption
Partner closely and uplift pricing capability with Sales, Category, Finance, Supply Chain and Marketing to support pricing opportunities, tenders, range reviews and margin expansion
Equip sales teams with real-time tools, insights and guardrails to drive better customer outcomes
Partner with Tech to design pricing workflows in the ERP and related systems.
Shape the enterprise commercial data strategy and lead the analytics roadmap
Build capability across Sales, Category and Finance through training and coaching
About you:

You have led organisation-wide change in pricing, data transformation or commercial governance
You are excited about shaping pricing capability in a high-growth, market leading organisation
You are energised by building capability from the ground up in a complex, multi-channel, multi customer type environment
You have advanced analytical skills ‚Äî able to synthesise complex data into narratives that influence behaviour and uplift commercial decision-making
You have strong commercial and financial acumen with deep experience in pricing and margin management
You are highly systems-oriented, comfortable with ERP, BI, pricing, AI and data platforms
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, Commerce, Economics, Mathematics or related discipline
A number of years‚Äô experience in pricing, commercial or analytical roles within Wholesale, Distribution and B2B environments

This is a senior opportunity to shape, uplift, and mature technology and cyber risk governance across a complex, highly regulated environment.
¬†¬†
This role can be fully remote for candidates based on the East Coast of Australia.
¬†¬†
About the Role
As the Manager of D&T Risk Governance, you‚Äôll lead the design, implementation, and continuous improvement of operational risk and control frameworks across the Data & Technology division. You‚Äôll own governance processes, uplift risk maturity, and ensure alignment to APRA CPS standards, ISO 27001, NIST CSF and broader enterprise risk frameworks. You‚Äôll drive transparent risk reporting, senior governance forums, and build strong partnerships across Technology, Security, Line 2 Risk, Internal Audit and Privacy teams.
¬†¬†
What You‚Äôll Be Doing

Lead and enhance data & technology risk governance frameworks
Oversee risk taxonomies, control frameworks, and escalation processes
Run the ‚ÄúLine 1.5‚Äù advisory function, supporting risk and control owners
Embed a new risk and control taxonomy into the GRC system
Deliver high-quality risk dashboards, KRIs, heatmaps and board reporting
Lead governance forums and influence senior stakeholders
Own policy and procedure oversight for technology risk governance
Ensure compliance with APRA CPS 220/230/234, ISO 27001, NIST CSF and ACSC requirements
Support internal/external audits and regulatory engagement
Lead and develop a small team within the technology risk function
¬†¬†
What We‚Äôre Looking For

10+ years in technology, cyber or operational risk governance
Experience in an APRA-regulated environment is essential
Strong knowledge of APRA CPS 220/230/234, ISO 27001/27005, NIST CSF and FAR
Experience designing and managing risk governance or control frameworks
Strong understanding of technology concepts and cyber risk
Skilled in preparing governance reporting for senior leadership and boards
Proven ability to run governance forums and drive accountability
Experience with GRC tools (highly regarded)
Relevant qualifications or certifications (e.g., CRISC, ISO 31000, COBIT) beneficial
¬†¬†
Perks & Benefits

Health & wellbeing:¬†Access to health programs, digital wellbeing hub, subsidised insurance
Flexibility:¬†Truly flexible working options and a strong focus on work/life balance
Community & giving:¬†Volunteer leave and donation matching up to $1,000 per year
Leave benefits:¬†Purchased leave options, parental leave and wellbeing leave
Lifestyle discounts:¬†Retail savings, travel discounts, salary packaging, tech & lifestyle perks
Inclusive culture:¬†A welcoming workplace that values diversity and belonging
¬†¬†
Apply now or reach out for a confidential conversation.

About the role

We‚Äôre seeking a Business Analyst for a 12-month part-time contract (3 days per week) to support a major finance systems transformation for a large community housing focused organisation.

You‚Äôll work across discovery, process analysis, configuration guidance and stakeholder engagement as they transition away from their current finance platform.

A key part of the role involves shaping integrations with ServiceNow and supporting tenancy-linked finance workflows across a staged roadmap.

With flexibility to choose your hours and days of work every week this position offers autonomy, influence and the chance to uplift core finance capability with strong support from internal stakeholders and technical teams.

What you‚Äôll do

A Glimpse into Your New Role

As an AI and Automation Consultant, you will be a client-facing and hands-on contributor responsible for identifying, developing, and implementing AI and automation solutions that deliver measurable efficiencies across both client environments and internal operations. While based in the Melbourne office, you will regularly travel to client sites and delivery locations to support the delivery of our consulting offering. This includes working directly with clients to assess, document, and optimise systems and processes, using Acquire Intelligence‚Äôs consulting framework to guide delivery.




You will be responsible for producing high-quality consulting reports, presentations, and detailed workflow and process documentation to support findings and recommendations. You will also contribute to internal transformation initiatives.




You must be technically capable, commercially aware, and confident engaging with senior stakeholders. You will represent Acquire Intelligence professionally on site with clients while being comfortable working at a detailed level within systems and operational workflows.




Identify, qualify and close mid-market and enterprise opportunities for Remote Teams & Co-Sourcing.
¬†

Key Responsibilities

Identify opportunities for AI and automation within client environments and internal operations, and propose practical, innovative solutions.

Measure and report on the impact and effectiveness of implemented solutions, making iterative improvements where necessary to maximise value.

Support internal transformation initiatives and contribute to the development of Acquire Intelligence‚Äôs consulting frameworks and methodologies.

Undertake other related duties or initiatives as assigned.
¬†

What You‚Äôll Bring

Proven hands-on operational experience in CX and/or business process environments, with a deep understanding of how workflows and systems operate in practice.

Entrepreneurial mindset,¬†value individuals who have taken initiative to launch a business, lead a department, or drive transformation from the ground up.

Demonstrated passion for AI, automation, and business efficiency, someone who actively follows emerging trends and technologies and applies them with purpose.

A natural problem solver who thrives on understanding how things work and finding smarter, faster, more effective ways to improve them.

Confident communicator with the presence and professionalism to engage clients, lead discussions, and present solutions to both technical and non-technical audiences.

Highly driven, fast-moving, and adaptable, with a strong bias for action and a proactive, solutions-oriented attitude.

Experience in consulting or client-facing roles is welcome but not essential ‚Äî we prioritize mindset, capability, and outcomes over job titles.




What Success Looks Like

Strong alignment with Acquire‚Äôs core values and culture

Successful delivery of AI and automation initiatives that result in measurable operational improvements for clients and internal stakeholders

High levels of client satisfaction and confidence in the value delivered through consulting engagements

Clear, professional communication and effective collaboration across cross-functional teams and with clients

Active contribution to a culture of innovation, ownership, and continuous improvement

Entrepreneurial Energy:¬†Think like an owner. Solve like a founder.

Fast with Intent:¬†We move fast and deliver real results.

Laugh and Learn:¬†We don‚Äôt take ourselves too seriously, just our results.

Come for a career, stay for the fun

About the opportunity

As Risk and Assurance Manager, you will play a pivotal leadership role, working closely with the Head of Legal and Risk, Executive and wider senior management to drive the development and implementation of enterprise risk and assurance governance, managing a small team. This senior role empowers business units, drives a robust risk culture, and provides strategic insights to senior management, Executive and the Board. The position is integral to ensuring that our enterprise risk management capabilities support the achievement of our strategic priorities; facilitating innovation, organisational resilience, and advising on emerging risk trends in a dynamic, technology-enabled environment. This role will embrace and implement technological advances to support the development of enterprise strategy, through deeper and near real-time data driven insights.¬†

Key responsibilities

Oversee the operation of, and continually strengthen the Enterprise Risk Management Framework¬†
Provide strategic risk and assurance advice to the Head of Legal and Risk, Executive, senior management and the Board

Advise on emerging internal and external risk developments and trends, including technology developments

What we‚Äôre looking for

Experience in a complex and compliance-driven environment
Proven ability to embed risk and assurance management into business operations and culture

Our Company

About the Role

We're looking for a highly skilled and experienced Senior SAP Functional Analyst to join our dynamic IT team at our Daikin Park in Warwick Farm, NSW. In this role, you will analyse the business problems and requirements to design a fully functional solution, assisting the Enterprise Architect to evaluate and finalise the SAP solutions. This is a fantastic opportunity to make a significant impact within a leading global company.

Your key responsibilities will include:


SAP System Expertise & Support: Leading the entire lifecycle of SAP Supply Chain Management (SCM) module (including WM, MM, PP) implementation and optimisation. You'll translate business needs into effective SAP solutions to enhance the supply chain, improve inventory, and optimise production, ensuring seamless integration with other SAP systems and providing functional expertise throughout project phases.

Business Process Analysis and Optimisation: Focuses on optimising supply chain management processes by analysing current operations and recommending improvements. You'll collaborate closely with business users to gather and document their requirements, then map these needs to existing or new SAP functionalities. A key objective is to identify and implement process automation and efficiency gains to streamline operations and reduce costs.


SAP Configuration and Customisation: Involved in the configuration of SAP modules like SCM (Core WM, MM and PP) to align with business requirements and best practices. You'll also develop functional specifications for custom developments, collaborating closely with the technical team. A key responsibility is to conduct and support testing phases (unit, integration, and UAT) to ensure SAP solutions function correctly and perform optimally.

Problem Resolution & Optimisation: Act as a key resource for troubleshooting and resolving critical SAP incidents and problems. You'll perform root cause analysis, implement corrective actions, and proactively identify areas for system optimisation to enhance performance and user experience.

Project Leadership & Collaboration: Play a vital role in SAP-related projects, including upgrades, migrations, and new module implementations. You'll work seamlessly with other IT teams (e.g., Basis, ABAP developers), external consultants, and business users to deliver successful outcomes.




We're looking for someone who brings:

You're a highly experienced and technically proficient SAP professional with a deep understanding of supply chain processes and a passion for optimizing systems. You're a natural problem-solver, an excellent communicator, and thrive in a dynamic, multicultural environment.

We're looking for someone who brings:

Higher education in Computer Sciences / Any Engineering Studies, and related SAP certification is mandatory.

Minimum of 10 years of hands-on/proven experience in SAP SCM functional roles covering Materials Management (MM), Production Planning (PP), Sales and Distribution (SD), and Warehouse Management (WM).

Proven experience in full life-cycle SAP implementations, including gathering requirements, configuring systems, conducting testing, and supporting go-live.

Experience in S/4HANA System conversion is a must.

Proficient and strong understanding of supply chain processes such as procurement, inventory management, production planning, and order fulfilment.

Knowledge of SQL and PL/SQL, with experience in Manhattan Scale highly preferred.


Ability to write functional specifications for custom developments and support ABAP teams as needed.

Experience with SAP interfaces, integrations, and EDI (Electronic Data Interchange) with Manhattan Scale is beneficial.




Why Join Us?

Collaborative work environment fostering a positive team culture.

Competitive salary + Superannuation + Performance bonus.

Equipment for work will be provided, such as a work laptop and work phone.

Provided with on-the-job training for continuous career growth opportunities.

Discounted Bupa Health Fund.

Flare Benefits ‚Äì Discounted gift cards, novated leases, discounted health/car/home loans.

Be part of a global number 1 company in HVAC.

Be part of a dynamic team that values innovation, collaboration, and personal growth.

Free parking on site at our Warwick Farm, Daikin Park.




We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

Job Title: Process Lead / Process Transformation Lead (Enterprise Process Uplift)
Ad Text:
Position Description
Title: Process Lead / Process Transformation Lead (Enterprise Process Uplift)
Location: Sydney (Hybrid)
¬†
Role Overview
NSW Government organisation is undertaking an enterprise-wide uplift to improve how business processes are documented, owned, maintained and continuously improved. This role will lead the establishment of a central process repository, uplift the organisation's approach to process design and documentation, and embed sustainable ways of working that support delivery, governance and continuous improvement.

This role blends process leadership, technical acumen, and delivery capability. It is suited to someone who sits comfortably between business and technology, with the ability to drive outcomes rather than simply produce documentation.

As Process Lead, you will work across the organisation to bring together fragmented process artefacts into a single view of truth, define practical standards and frameworks, and deliver tangible uplift while the capability is still being built.
¬†
Key Objectives

Establish a single enterprise repository for business process documentation
Lead the documentation of core organisational processes in a fit-for-purpose manner
Define and embed new ways of working for how processes are governed, maintained and improved
Balance documentation with practical delivery and measurable improvement outcomes
Support leadership decision-making through improved visibility and prioritisation of process areas
Enable ongoing process maturity rather than a one-off documentation exercise
Key Responsibilities Process Leadership & Strategy

Lead the design and rollout of an enterprise-wide process management approach
Shape how icare documents, governs and improves processes at scale
Establish consistent standards for process modelling, ownership and lifecycle management
Define operating models for how process ownership works across business units
Delivery & Execution

Own the implementation of the central process repository
Drive documentation of priority processes through sprint-based delivery
Balance foundational documentation with continuous improvement delivery
Deliver incrementally and demonstrate value along the way
Adapt delivery approach in response to leadership priorities and organisational readiness
Stakeholder Engagement

Work closely with senior leaders, business owners and subject matter experts
Influence without reliance on formal authority
Manage competing priorities across functions
Build buy-in for pragmatic and sustainable process practices
Governance & Continuous Improvement

Define controls for quality, governance and maintenance of process artefacts
Establish feedback loops and measurement practices
Ensure the repository remains relevant, usable and valuable long-term
Enable transition from implementation to a mature process capability
Skills & Experience Essential

Proven leadership in enterprise process transformation
Experience implementing process repositories / BPM platforms
Strong delivery background across large, complex organisations
Demonstrated ability to balance documentation with real-world outcomes
Deep understanding of process design, modelling and governance
Experience working within matrixed organisations
Ability to influence across technical, business and executive audiences
Comfortable operating where priorities shift and ambiguity exists
Desirable

Experience in financial services, insurance or regulated environments
Exposure to BPMN and enterprise architecture concepts
Familiarity with sprint-based or agile delivery models
Experience operating at transformation / enterprise level rather than team-level only
Personal Attributes

Outcome-driven rather than document-driven
Pragmatic with strong commercial judgement
Comfortable challenging assumptions respectfully
Confident operating at executive level
Resilient in a changing environment
Able to navigate politics without losing integrity
Balanced in thinking between strategic and operational
Success in the Role Looks Like

A functioning, adopted central process repository
Core processes documented and actively used
Clear ownership and accountability models
Leadership visibility on process maturity and priorities
Evidence of improvement delivered during documentation
A sustainable framework that continues beyond the role

About Us¬†

At CleanCo we are delivering clean energy solutions to help our customers thrive in a net zero future.

We own and operate more than 1GW of low emission energy generation and we are actively growing our portfolio to help propel Queensland‚Äôs energy transformation.

We are a passionate, inclusive team committed to creating a clean energy future for Queensland. If our mission resonates with you, consider a career with CleanCo.

About the Opportunity

As our SAP Reporting Specialist, you‚Äôll play a key role in helping CleanCo make confident, data-driven decisions. Working with SAP RISE and SAP Analytics Cloud, you‚Äôll shape the reporting and insights that our teams rely on every day.

You‚Äôll build and refine reporting frameworks, ensure our data is accurate and trusted, and work closely with colleagues and partners to keep our systems connected, compliant, and easy to use. About Beon Energy Solutions:

Beon is a company of dedicated professionals committed to future-focused energy solutions with a heritage in safety and reliability. We bring technical expertise and agility to provide energy solutions from every angle for; renewable energy, utility and infrastructure, commercial and industrial projects across Australia.

We deploy large-scale renewable energy and infrastructure projects, with expertise in design, construction and maintenance. Our clients include some of Australia‚Äôs largest electricity utilities, infrastructure and renewable developers, commercial and industrial companies and transport network operators.

About the Role:

We are looking for an experienced Systems Data Analyst to join our Project Controls team based at our Melbourne‚Äôs CBD head office on a full time and permanent basis.¬†

The Systems Data Analyst is responsible for collecting, validating, analysing and reporting quality-related and construction progress data across the full project lifecycle. The role will ensure the integrity, traceability and consistency of data within digital quality and construction reporting platforms, supporting project teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.

The insights provided by this role will directly influence quality performance, construction productivity, risk management, client reporting and continuous improvement across Beon‚Äôs portfolio of solar, BESS and infrastructure projects. You will also contribute to the standardisation and optimisation of digital tools, dashboards and reporting processes across the business.

What you‚Äôll deliver:

Maintain accuracy, completeness and consistency of quality and construction data within platforms such as TrueContext/ProntoForms, Procore and other QMS tools

Establish new projects within digital systems, including structures, registers, templates and user permissions aligned to the Quality Management Plan

Conduct regular data validation, reconciliation and housekeeping activities to identify gaps or discrepancies and support corrective actions

Enhance digital forms, templates and workflows to meet project and client requirements

Provide evidence-based recommendations to improve QA/QC processes, inspection planning, defect close-out and construction sequencing

Extract and analyse quality and construction performance data to produce dashboards, progress reports and visualisations

Perform integrity checks and calculations to support key quality and construction KPIs used by Project Managers, Quality Leads and senior stakeholders

Assist with compiling audit evidence, handover documentation and client submissions, ensuring alignment with QMS and contractual requirements

Collaborate with project teams, site personnel and subcontractors to improve data capture and the timely completion of digital records

Provide training, support and guidance to promote consistent use of digital quality and construction reporting tools

To succeed in this role you‚Äôll have:

Bachelor of Engineering, Information Technology, Mathematics or a related technical/commercial degree

Strong foundation in data analysis methods and techniques

Ability to interpret complex quality and construction data, identify root causes and deliver clear insights

Proficiency in Excel (advanced), SQL and/or Python is highly desirable

Understanding of the Australian energy sector (preferred).

Strong analytical thinking, problem-solving and continuous improvement mindset.

Demonstrated experience working with data management and analysis in engineering, construction, quality or similar environments

Proven stakeholder management skills and the ability to engage cross-functional teams to drive data accuracy

Strong written and verbal communication, with high attention to detail.
